snippet: By tracking one patient’s immune response, scientists have discovered how a series of mutations led to an antibody that could defeat many H.I.V. strains.
abstract: American scientists, in what may be important step toward long-elusive AIDS vaccine, minutely track one person's powerful immune response to the virus to see how series of mutations led to an antibody that can defeat many HIV strains; study is published in journal Nature.
lead_paragraph: By tracking one patient’s immune response, scientists have discovered how a series of mutations led to an antibody that could defeat many H.I.V. strains.

headline.seo: AIDS Vaccine Path Suggested by Study
headline.main: Possible Path to Vaccine for AIDS Is Suggested
headline.print_headline: Possible Path To Vaccine For AIDS Is Suggested
